text: Salomón Asumu Obama Ondo (born 4 February 2000) is an Equatoguinean professional footballer who plays as a forward for Segunda División B club Mérida AD, on loan from Celta de Vigo B, and the Equatorial Guinea national team. He also holds Spanish citizenship. ==Professional career== Obama moved to Spain at a young age from Equatorial Guinea, and raised in Torrejón. Salómón joined the youth academy of Atlético Madrid in 2008. On January 31, 2019, Obama signed for Celta de Vigo, from Atletico Madrid. ==International career== Obama, at the age of 18, was called up to the senior Equatorial Guinea national football team in August 2018. He previously played for the Spanish under-17 team. He made his national team debut as a substitute against Sudan in the 2019 Africa Cup of Nations qualification. ==Personal life== Obama's twin brother, Federico Obama, is also a footballer for Atlético Madrid (at youth level) and a senior international for Equatorial Guinea. ==References== ==External links== *Atlético Madrid profile * * * Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:Association football forwards Category:Equatoguinean footballers Category:Twin sportspeople Category:Twin people from Equatorial Guinea Category:People from Malabo Category:Fang people Category:Equatorial Guinea international footballers Category:Equatoguinean emigrants to Spain Category:Naturalised citizens of Spain Category:Spanish footballers Category:Madrilenian footballers Category:Spain youth international footballers Category:Twin people from Spain Category:Spanish people of Equatoguinean descent Category:Segunda División B players Category:Atlético Madrid B players Category:Mérida AD players
title: Salomón Obama
